etymologies: early 17th century: from French, from par terre ‘on the ground’

definitions: a level space in a garden or yard occupied by an ornamental arrangement of flower beds

examples.text: he was planting bulbs in the parterre for a spring display

shortDefinitions: level space in garden occupied by ornamental arrangement of flower beds

definitions: the part of the ground floor of an auditorium in the rear and on the sides, especially the part beneath the balcony.
shortDefinitions: part of ground floor of theatre auditorium behind orchestra pit
